This place is incredible!! The house was comfortable, private, and located on a beautiful and secluded piece of land. It was attractively furnished and had every supply you could need -- cooking supplies and spices, towels, soaps, blankets, you name it.
Kerri and Mike were superb hosts. They went the extra mile to give us detailed instructions, answer all of our questions, and help us out when we were at the house.
For visitors coming during the cold weather: the house was a great place for snuggling up with a good book and watching the snow fall. It has a wood pellet stove which was a nice touch that left us feeling very cozy in the frigid winter weather. When it snowed, Mike plowed the driveway and shoveled around our car.
For nature lovers, this place is also located a reasonable drive to several notable wildlife viewing locations, including several state parks and state game lands. We checked out Yellow Creek State Park and Prince Gallitzin State Park, both of which had hundreds of waterfowl on the water. There were also plenty of birds eating from the bird feeders around the house.
When you stay, check out Kerri and Mike's Fat Caps Fungi, which has lots of different mushroom-based products for sale. I really liked the Sweet Balsamic and Fig Mushroom Jerky.

You will stay upstairs and that bedroom has a very pretty view. Canoe Creek is minutes away if you're up for a hike or swim (fishing too) and Raystown is a short drive. The Altoona Curve ballpark is a quick 10-12 min drive over Frankstown mountain. Altoona is 10-15 minutes and Hollidaysburg is even closer. I will definitely ask to book again and cannot get enough of the interior Knotty Pine cabin feel and serene setting of this cabin. Thank you Joshua!
